title: Impact of religious cleavage in Russia and Nigeria

content.prompt: Which of the following statements accurately describes the effects of political cleavages in two AP course countries?

choices.label: The United Kingdom and Iran, both being unitary states, do not have substantial political cleavages.
Nigerian and Russian governments both grapple with a Christian-Muslim cleavage that has led to acts of political violence in both countries.
Mexico and the United Kingdom both have substantial and violent east-west cleavages that warrant immediate political solutions.
Russia and Iran, both being ethnically and religiously homogeneous, do not suffer from any notable political cleavages.

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Explain the implications of the similarities and differences between countries with similar political systems, principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
